text.section: After February 1, 2008, to receive a credit payment a certified ethanol or biodiesel producer shall file a claim with the Board by the end of January, April, July, and October of each year.

A claim filed under this section shall state:
The producer's total ethanol production in the State during the previous quarter, categorized by ethanol produced from small grains and ethanol produced from other agricultural products; or
The producer's total biodiesel production in Maryland during the previous quarter, categorized by biodiesel produced from:
The location of the producer;
The average number of Maryland citizens employed by the producer in the previous quarter;
For an ethanol producer, the number of bushels of Maryland-grown small grains and other agricultural commodities used by the producer in the previous quarter; or
For a biodiesel producer, the number of gallons of Maryland-produced soybean oil and other bio-based oils used by the producer in the previous quarter; and
Any other information that the Board requires.

A claim filed under this section shall be reviewed by an independent certified public accountant with respect to, as appropriate:
The total ethanol production;
The breakdown between ethanol produced from small grains and ethanol produced from other agricultural products;
The total biodiesel production; and
The breakdown between biodiesel produced from:
Soybean oil produced in a facility that began operating after December 31, 2004, or under the expanded capacity of a facility, the expansion of which occurred after December 31, 2004; and
Other feedstock, including soybean oil produced in a facility that began operating on or before December 31, 2004.
A claim submitted to the Board under this section is not subject to disclosure under the Maryland Public Information Act.
